exam_papers.title: 2025年6月大学英语六级考试真题（二）
exam_papers.description: 2025年6月大学英语六级考试真题（第二套），包含写作、听力、阅读理解和翻译四个部分

exam_sections.directions: For this part you are allowed 30 minutes to write an essay that begins with the sentence "As social media is used more and more extensively, there is a growing awareness of the importance of using it properly and responsibly." You can make comments, cite examples or use your personal experiences to develop your essay. You should write at least 150 words but no more than 200 words.

In this section, you will hear two long conversations. At the end of each conversation, you will hear four questions. Both the conversation and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C), and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, you will hear two passages. At the end of each passage, you will hear three or four questions. Both the passage and the questions will be spoken only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C), and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section you will hear three recordings of lectures or talks followed by three or four questions. The recordings will be played only once. After you hear a question, you must choose the best answer from the four choices marked A), B), C) and D). Then mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 1 with a single line through the centre.

In this section, there is a passage with ten blanks. You are required to select one word for each blank from a list of choices given in a word bank following the passage. Read the passage through carefully before making your choices. Each choice in the bank is identified by a letter. Please mark the corresponding letter for each item on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre. You may not use any of the words in the bank more than once.
exam_sections.passage_content:
No beast on Earth is tougher than the tiny tardigrade (缓步类动物). It can "___26___ being frozen at -272° Celsius being exposed to the vacuum of outer space and even being ___27___ with 500 times the dose of X-rays that would kill a human. In other words, the creature can endure conditions that don't even exist on Earth. And researchers are looking to the microscopic animals to learn how to prepare humans and crops to handle the ___28___ of space travel.

The tardigrade's indestructibility stems from its ___29___ to its environment — which may seem surprising, since it lives in ___30___ comfortable places like the cool, wet patches of moss (青苔) that dot a garden wall.

But it turns out that a tardigrade's damp, mossy home can dry out many times each year. Drying is pretty ___31___ for most living things. It does damage to cells in some of the same ways that freezing, vacuum and radiation do. Tardigrades, however, have ___32___ special strategies for dealing with these kinds of damage.

As a tardigrade dries out, its cells produce several strange proteins that are unlike anything found in other animals. In water, the proteins are shapeless. But as water disappears, the proteins self-assemble into long fibers that fill the cell's ___33___. The fibers support the cell's membranes (细胞膜) and proteins, preventing them from breaking or ___34___.

Emulating tardigrades could one day help humans colonize outer space. Food crops could be engineered to produce tardigrade proteins, allowing these organisms to grow more efficiently on spacecraft where levels of radiation are elevated compared with on Earth.

So if humans ever succeed in reaching the stars, they may accomplish this ___35___, in part, by standing on the shoulders of the tiny eight-legged endurance specialists in your backyard.

exam_sections.directions: In this section, you are going to read a passage with ten statements attached to it. Each statement contains information given in one of the paragraphs. Identify the paragraph from which the information is derived. You may choose a paragraph more than once. Each paragraph is marked with a letter. Answer the questions by marking the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.passage_content:
A) As the scale and impacts of climate change become increasingly alarming, meat is a popular target for action. Advocates for the protection of the natural environment from destruction or pollution urge the public to eat less meat. Some activists have even called for taxing meat to reduce consumption of it.

B) A key claim underlying these arguments holds that globally, meat production generates more greenhouse gases than the entire transportation sector. However, this claim is demonstrably wrong, as I will show. And its persistence has led to false assumptions about the linkage between meat and climate change.

C) My recent research focuses on ways in which animal agriculture affects air quality and climate change. In my view, there are many reasons for either choosing animal protein or opting for a vegetarian selection. However, abandoning meat and meat products is not the environmental panacea (万灵药) many would have us believe. And if taken to an extreme, it also could have harmful nutritional consequences.

D) A healthy portion of meat's negative reputation centers on the assertion that livestock is the largest source of greenhouse gases worldwide. For example, an analysis published in 2009 by the World Watch Institute based in Washington, D.C. asserted that 51 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions come from rearing and processing livestock. According to the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, the largest sources of U.S. greenhouse gas emissions in 2016 were electricity production (28 percent of total emissions), transportation (28 percent) and industry (22 percent). All of agriculture accounted for a total of 9 percent, but all of animal agriculture contributes less than half of this amount, representing 3.9 percent of the total greenhouse emission in the U.S. That is very different from claiming that livestock represents as much as or more than transportation.

E) Why is there such a misconception? In 2006, the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) published a study titled "Livestock's Long Shadow," which received widespread international attention. It stated that livestock produced a staggering 18 percent of the world's greenhouse gas emissions. The agency drew a startling conclusion that livestock was doing more to harm the climate than all modes of transportation combined. This latter claim was wrong, and has since been corrected by Henning Stenfeld, the report's senior author.

F) The problem was that analysts from the FAO used a comprehensive life-cycle assessment to study the climate impact of livestock, but a different method when they analyzed transportation. For livestock, they considered every factor associated with producing meat. This included emissions from fertilizer production, converting land from forests to pastures, growing feed, and direct emissions from animals (manure as well as expelling of gas from the stomach) from birth to death.

G) However, when they looked at transportation's carbon footprint, they ignored impacts on the climate from manufacturing vehicle materials and parts, assembling vehicles and maintaining roads, bridges and airports. Instead, they only considered the exhaust smoke emitted by finished cars, trucks, trains and planes. As a result, the FAO's comparison of greenhouse gas emissions from livestock to those from transportation was greatly distorted.

H) I pointed out this flaw during a speech to fellow scientists in San Francisco on March 22, 2010, which led to a flood of media coverage. To its credit, the FAO immediately owned up to its error. Unfortunately, the agency's initial claim that livestock was responsible for the lion's share of world greenhouse gas emissions had already received wide coverage. To this day, we struggle to "turning" the bell. In its most recent assessment report, the FAO estimated that livestock produces 14.5 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions from human activities. There is no comparable full life-cycle assessment for transportation. However, as Stenfeld has pointed out, direct emissions from transportation versus livestock can be compared and amount to 14 versus 5 percent respectively.

I) Many people continue to think that avoiding meat as infrequently as once a week will make a significant difference to the climate. But according to one recent study, even if Americans eliminated all animal protein from their diets, they would reduce U.S. greenhouse gas emissions by only 2.6 percent. According to our research at the University of California, Davis, if the practice of Meatless Monday were to be adopted by all Americans, we'd see a reduction of only 0.5 percent.

J) Moreover, technological, genetic and management changes that have taken place in U.S. agriculture over the past 70 years have made livestock production more efficient and less greenhouse gas-intensive. According to the FAO's statistical database, total direct greenhouse gas emissions from U.S. livestock have declined by 11.3 percent since 1961, while production of livestock meat has more than doubled.

K) Demand for meat is rising in developing and emerging economies, especially in the Middle East, North Africa and Southeast Asia. For example, raising livestock such as goats in Kenya is an important source of food and income for many small-scale farmers and herders. But meat consumption per person in these regions still lags that of developed countries. In 2015, average annual meat consumption per person in developed countries was 92 kilograms, compared to 24 kilograms in the Middle East and North Africa and 18 kilograms in Southeast Asia. Still, given projected population growth in the developing world, there will certainly be an opportunity for countries such as the United States to bring their sustainable livestock rearing practices to the table.

L) Removing animals from U.S. agriculture would lower national greenhouse gas emissions to a small degree, but it would also make it harder to meet people's nutritional requirements. Many critics of animal agriculture are quick to point out that if farmers raised only plants, they could produce more pounds of food and more calories per person. But humans also need many essential micro- and macro-nutrients for good health. It's hard to make a compelling argument that the United States has a calorie deficit, given its high national rates of adult and child obesity. Moreover, not all plant parts are edible or desirable. Raising livestock is a way to add nutritional and economic value to plant agriculture.

M) As one example, the energy in plants that livestock consume is most often contained in cellulose (纤维素), which is indigestible for humans and many other mammals. But cows, sheep and other ruminant (反刍的) animals can break cellulose down and release the solar energy contained in this vast resource. According to the FAO, as much as 70 percent of all agricultural land globally is range land that can only be utilized as grazing land for ruminant livestock.

N) The world population is currently projected to reach 9.8 billion by 2050. Feeding this many people will raise immense challenges. Meat is more calorie-dense per serving than vegetarian options, and ruminant animals largely thrive on feed that is not suitable for humans. Raising livestock also offers much-needed income for small-scale farmers in developing nations. Worldwide livestock provides a livelihood for 1 billion people.

O) Climate change demands urgent attention, and the livestock industry has a large overall environmental footprint that affects air, water and land. These, combined with a rapidly rising world population, give us plenty of compelling reasons to continue to work for greater efficiencies in animal agriculture. I believe the place to start is with science-based facts.
exam_sections.passage_title: Yes, eating meat affects the environment, but cows are not killing the climate

exam_sections.directions: There are 2 passages in this section. Each passage is followed by some questions or unfinished statements. For each of them there are four choices marked A), B), C), and D). You should decide on the best choice and mark the corresponding letter on Answer Sheet 2 with a single line through the centre.
exam_sections.passage_content:
Passage One

Why are we so worried about our careers? Partly it's to do with money, but there's a psychological aspect to our fears as well.

We worry because we suspect — not wrongly — that the world is full of a frightening sort of person ready to judge us ruthlessly and swiftly: a person we can call a snob.

A snob is anyone who takes a relatively small part of us and uses it to come to a rigid conclusion about how much of their attention we deserve. In the past that might be your ancestry and royal connections. Nowadays, the snob cares about one thing only: what you do for a living.

This explains why the first question we will be asked in any new social context is "What do you do?" and according to how we answer, snobs will either welcome us with broad smiles, or leave us in the cold.

And that is why we are fired up by Such a desperate urge to achieve and impress.

Sometimes our behaviour is mistaken for greed and vanity, but it is more than this. A lot of our interest in fancy cars, jobs and houses has nothing to do with materialism. It has to do with a hunger for the respect and esteem that is only available in our societies through the acquisition of material goods. It isn't the goods themselves we seek, it is the love we stand to gain through our possession of them. The next time we see someone driving a Ferrari, we shouldn't condemn them for their greed, we should pity them for the intensity of their need for love from the world.

At the root of snobbery is a lack of imagination and confidence about how to decide who in the world is valuable. The snobs are brutally misguided and slavish in their beliefs about how the superior individuals can be identified. For snobs, it is the already acclaimed and already successful who are the only ones worthy of respect. There is no room in their timid regimented minds to imagine that someone might be clever, kind or good — and yet somehow have been overlooked entirely by society, their qualities lying hidden beneath an unfamiliar veil, and having as yet discovered no obvious outlet.

The true answer to snobbery is not to say that there is no such thing as a better or worse person, but to insist that better or worse exist in constantly unexpected places and carry none of the outward signs of distinction. And because we are such poor judges of the worth of others, our ultimate duty remains to be kind, good curious and imaginative about pretty much everyone who ever crosses our path.

Passage Two

Women have historically been paid less. But in the US in the 1980s, they began to catch up — fast. During that decade, the gender pay gap closed by about one percentage point a year. Had that trend continued, the gender wage gap would have been closed by 2017.

But the trend didn't continue, and the gap remains yawning.

According to a new study from academics at Harvard, the stagnation can be put down, perhaps counterintuitively, to the introduction of state and federal family leave policies.

The academics argue that during the 1990s, as governments began to introduce leave policies, it was mainly women who took advantage of them. Though the leave policies might have helped those women to stay in the workplace — instead of dropping out to have families — those who returned saw their wages had increased at lower rates than the men.

After family leave was introduced in the US, in fact, the rate of gender wage convergence fell to just 0.03 percentage points per year, and has remained there ever since.

Those monitoring the process towards salary equity at work have long watched as progress slowed in many countries around the world. In fact, that progress began to reverse during the pandemic (大流行病).

The gender pay gap is one of the most outstanding examples of that lack of parity (平等), and still exists just about everywhere. The motherhood penalty has become a shorthand for describing why: In many places, especially rich countries, women earn the same as men until they reach their childbearing years. Women who have children begin to see their salaries slip behind their male counterparts.

Part of this is because women take on more of the unpaid labor at home, which can eat into time available for work and energy for career advancement. But it's also because mothers are passed over for raises and promotion, and because time out of the workplace sets women back, even if that time is taken voluntarily, and supported by company or government policy.

What would have happened if leave policies hadn't been introduced? The study doesn't go into that question, other than to say that if the 1980s trend continued, we would have been at parity by now.

It's possible, however, that the journey towards wage parity would have stalled either way. If women's gains in the 1980s were made through the erasure of things like bias, once those less uncontrollable problems had been addressed, there would still have been an issue with women — who are the ones to bear children and take care of them in the early weeks because of biological factors like the ability to breastfeed, forcing them to take breaks, whether or not those breaks were mandated.

exam_sections.directions: For this part, you are allowed 30 minutes to translate a passage from Chinese into English. You should write your answer on Answer Sheet 2.
exam_sections.translation_content: 粤港澳大湾区(Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macao Greater Bay Area)具有得天独厚的地理位置，拥有完善的交通基础设施和丰富的产业资源。大湾区是中国开放程度最高、经济活力最强的区域之一，在国家经济发展中具有重要的战略地位。大湾区不仅将建成充满活力的世界级城市群和具有全球影响力的国际科技创新中心，还将打造成适合工作、购物、旅游的优质生活圈。随着改革开放的不断深入，大湾区的建设将进一步推动区域经济发展。到2035年，大湾区将实现成为国际一流湾区的目标。
exam_sections.translation_requirements: 请将以下中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法正确和表达流畅

exam_questions.question_text: Write an essay that begins with the sentence "As social media is used more and more extensively, there is a growing awareness of the importance of using it properly and responsibly."
exam_questions.analysis: 写作题目，需要学生根据给定的开头句写一篇关于社交媒体使用的议论文
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的议论文写作能力，包括论点阐述、论证支持和结论总结

exam_questions.question_text: Why does the man think it is difficult to make the decision?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They have to make a choice by the end of the day.", "B) Both candidates are very keen on getting the job.", "C) They hold different views on the procedure.", "D) Both candidates are quite competitive."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话开头，女士对男士说在今天结束之前必须定下该职位的候选人，男士回答说："是的，但要做出选择并不容易。两名申请人都很有实力。"由此可知，D项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Yes, but it isn't an easy choice to make. Both applicants are quite strong.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do the speakers say may be worth noting?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Both Rachel and Peter came across as respectful and professional.", "B) Rachel scored moderately higher grades than Peter at school.", "C) Both Rachel and Peter excelled in their academic pursuit.", "D) Peter appeared slightly stronger than Rachel physically."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中间，两人开始讨论两名候选人各自的优势，男士提到："唯一值得注意的不同之处可能是，瑞秋在整个高中和大学期间的成绩似乎都略胜一筹。"同时，女士也赞同这一点，由此可知，B项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'The only difference worth noting, perhaps, is that it looks like Rachel scored moderately stronger grades throughout high school and university.'

exam_questions.question_text: According to the man, what might account for Peter appearing somewhat more self-assured than Rachel?
exam_questions.options: ["A) His use of body language.", "B) His accumulation of experience.", "C) His unusual state of mind.", "D) His knowledge about the company."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，对话双方在对比两位候选人的差异时，男士表示："彼得不知为何显得更自信一些。也许是他们的肢体语言差异造成的。"由此可知，A项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Maybe it was something about their body language.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the man say they will do if they can't reach an agreement?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Compare the candidates side by side again.", "B) Ask the board to cast the deciding vote.", "C) Find a way to break the tie next time.", "D) Let John make the final decision."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话最后，男士说道："如果我们僵持不下，无法达成一致，那我们就把这件事交给约翰，让他来投决定性的一票吧。"由此可知，D项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'If there's a tie, and we can't come to an agreement, then we'll take it to John and let him cast the deciding vote.'

exam_questions.question_text: What are the speakers mainly talking about?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The private label "L'Orange".", "B) The woman's latest collection.", "C) This season's new fashion.", "D) The head designer's role."]
exam_questions.analysis: 主旨大意题。对话开头，男士介绍道："今天我们请到了私人时装品牌L'Orange的首席设计师克莱门汀·奥尔特加，一同探讨她的最新系列作品。"由此可知，B项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话开头：'We're here with Clementine Ortega, head designer of the private fashion label L'Orange, to discuss her latest collection.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say she always tries to incorporate into her aesthetic?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Something reflecting the social norms.", "B) Something meeting public expectations.", "C) Something slightly absurd.", "D) Something a bit ambiguous."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，女士说道："相反，我总是试图在自己的美学中加入些许荒诞的元素。"由此可知，C项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'Rather, I always try to incorporate something slightly absurd into my aesthetic.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the woman say she likes to do?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Merge styles often at opposite ends of the fashion spectrum.", "B) Learn from the designs of the Asian rural mountain villagers.", "C) Make velvet capes look both majestic and masculine.", "D) Draw intricate patterns onto a traditional power suit."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话中，女士说道："我喜欢融合时尚领域内常常对立的风格。"由此可知，A项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'I like to merge styles that are often at opposite ends of the fashion spectrum.'

exam_questions.question_text: What is the man looking forward to?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Obtaining the woman's signature.", "B) Seeing the woman's new creations.", "C) Incorporating indigenous aspects into his work.", "D) Sharing more ideas with the woman next time."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。对话最后，男士说道："您已证明自己是一位令人敬畏的年轻设计师，我们等不及看您接下来想出的作品。"由此可知，B项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 对话中提到：'You have proven yourself a formidable young designer, and we can't wait to see what creations you come up with next.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the passage say about 80% of participating dogs in the new study?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They could readily recognize their owner simply by looking.", "B) They could understand the implications of human commands.", "C) They could be domesticated to act as our companions.", "D) They could follow pointing gestures without training."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章开头部分提到，一项新研究调查了流浪狗是否能理解人类的手势。该研究显示，尽管这些参与研究的狗之前从未接受过相关训练，但仍有80%的狗能成功地根据指向性手势找到特定位置。选项D是对这句话的总结概括，故为正确选项。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'The study revealed that 80% of participating dogs successfully followed pointing gestures to a specific location despite having never received prior training.'

exam_questions.question_text: What may help alleviate the problem caused by stray dogs?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Cultivating them to be intelligent creatures.", "B) Training them to behave like domesticated dogs.", "C) Understanding how humans impact their behavior.", "D) Taking measures to reduce their numbers."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章提到，流浪狗与人类之间的冲突是个问题。了解人类如何影响流浪狗的行为可能有助于缓解这一问题。选项C中的impact与原文中的shape是同义词，都有"影响"的意思，故C项正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Understanding how humans shape stray dogs' behavior may help alleviate this problem.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do the researchers suggest we do to reduce conflicts between stray dogs and humans?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Tame them through repeated training.", "B) Treat them with sensitivity and respect.", "C) Make them responsive to our commands.", "D) Watch their behavior and try to improve it."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章最后是研究人员的建议：以体贴和尊重的态度对待流浪狗，并给它们空间，可以减少很多冲突。选项B几乎是文中的原词，符合研究人员的建议内容，故为正确选项。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Treating stray dogs with sensitivity and respect, and giving them space, the researchers assert, can reduce much conflict.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why is food product placement within the fridge very important?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The temperature inside it varies from place to place.", "B) Proper placement facilitates access to food products.", "C) Its different shelves are designed for different purposes.", "D) The space in an average fridge changes from top to bottom."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章开头即指出，普通冰箱内部的温度从前到后、从下到上，甚至各个角落实际上都存在差异。正因如此，食物在冰箱内的摆放位置远比你可能想象的要重要得多。选项A是对这部分内容的总结概括，故选项A正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'The temperature inside the average fridge actually varies from front to back, bottom to top and everywhere in between. Because of this, food product placement within the appliance is far more important than you probably realize.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the passage say is the whole purpose of the modern refrigerator?
exam_questions.options: ["A) To slow the rising of temperature in it.", "B) To provide a big box of evenly cold air.", "C) To prevent germs from growing quickly.", "D) To keep the food cold as long as possible."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章提到，现代冰箱的全部目的是减少缓细菌的繁殖。选项C中的prevent germs from growing quickly是原文中slow the growth of bacterial的同义转述，故C项正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'The whole purpose of the modern refrigerator is to slow the growth of bacteria...'

exam_questions.question_text: Where in the fridge should we store foods already cooked?
exam_questions.options: ["A) On the top shelf.", "B) In the middle section.", "C) On the inside of its doors.", "D) At the back of its bottom shelf."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章后半部分分别介绍了冰箱内部各个位置的温度情况以及各自适合存放哪种类型的食品。其中提到，冰箱上层的温度不如底层低，因此可以把那些不需要超低温保存的食物放在上层。即食品或已煮熟的食物可以放在上层架子上。因此，选项A正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Store foods that are ready to eat or already cooked on the top shelf.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why should we never store foods with high water content at the back of the bottom shelf?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They will be extra-chilly.", "B) They will be hard to defrost.", "C) They will be contaminated.", "D) They will be ruined."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。文章最后介绍，冰箱底层搁架的靠后区域是冰箱最冷的位置，适合存放容易变质的乳制品。千万不要在此存放水分含量高的食物，因为食物中的水分会结冰，从而让食物彻底变质。因此，选项D正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 文章中提到：'Never store foods with high water content here, because the water within them can and will freeze, effectively ruining them.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker say is quite common among older people?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Chronic depression.", "B) Growing feebleness.", "C) Hip fracture.", "D) Fatal infections."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。在讲话开头，讲话者便提到，髋部骨折在老年人中很常见。由此很容易得出，正确答案为C。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'In one project we are looking at hip fracture in older people, which is a common event...'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker think excites her most about her research?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It feels real and relevant.", "B) It contributes to psychology.", "C) It outcompetes lots of academics' research.", "D) It wins recognition outside of Birmingham."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者在讲话后面提到，"我认为我的研究最让我感到兴奋的地方在于它既真实又有意义"，题干中的excites...most和选项A中的it feels real and relevant均为原词复现。由此可知，选项A为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'I think the thing that excites me most about my research is that it feels real and relevant.'

exam_questions.question_text: How does the speaker approach her research project?
exam_questions.options: ["A) By bringing together experts old and young.", "B) By counting on advanced modem technology.", "C) By making full use of her expertise.", "D) By combining multiple perspectives"]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者在讲话最后提到："我们不仅仅局限于单一视角，比如只从心理医生的角度看待衰老和健康，而是现在整合了多种不同的技术和观点，来切实研究影响健康的各种因素。"由此可知，选项D为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'...rather than just taking one perspective...we are now bringing together a lot of different techniques and a lot of different viewpoints...'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker say about most colleges and graduate schools in America?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They don't teach basic organization.", "B) They don't focus on teaching techniques.", "C) They attach little importance to recipes.", "D) They hire very few distinguished chefs."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。在讲话开头，讲话者明确提到"大多数学院和研究生院不教授基本的组织技能"，选项A为原词复现，很容易得出其正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'...most colleges and graduate schools don't teach basic organization...'

exam_questions.question_text: How do students of the culinary institute of America view "mise-en-place" or "put in place"?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It's unique to celebrity chefs.", "B) It's a way of transformation.", "C) It's too demanding for them.", "D) It's a way of life to them."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者在中间提到，"Students at the culinary institute of America view it as a way of life"，选项D中的a way of life为原词复现，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'Students at the culinary institute of America view it as a way of life.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker advise us to do at the end of the talk?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Respect others so as to be respected.", "B) Use time and resources in a wise way.", "C) Cultivate a habit of self-discipline.", "D) Learn from philosophers earnestly"]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者在最后提到，"时间是宝贵的，资源是宝贵的，空间是宝贵的，你的自尊和他人的尊重也是宝贵的。要明智地利用它们。"很容易由此得出选项B为正确选项。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'...time is precious, resources are precious, space is precious, your self-respect and the respect of others are precious. Use them wisely.'

exam_questions.question_text: What should self-acceptance be used as according to the speaker?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The motive for hard work.", "B) The reason for stagnation.", "C) The basis for self-improvement.", "D) The justification for self-confidence."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者提到，自我接纳的错误在于，虽然自我接纳是必要的，但它实际上应该被用作成长的基础。当我们不再成长、学习和寻求生活中的进步时，我们就会停滞不前。由此可知，C项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'The mistake we make with this is that whilst self-acceptance is imperative, it should actually be used as the basis for growth.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do people tend to do when they have reached midlife?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Feel confidence, happiness and satisfaction.", "B) Believe they have achieved their life goals.", "C) Use a key tool for setting ambitious goals.", "D) Stop imagining further progress in life."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者提到，当我们到了中年时，我们往往停止梦想我们想要实现的目标，并对目标设定感到相当消极。我们不再因为实现目标而感到自信、快乐和满足，而是觉得自己总是达不到目标。由此可知，D项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'...by the time we've reached midlife, we've stopped dreaming about what we want to achieve and feel quite negatively about goal setting.'

exam_questions.question_text: Why do we find ourselves irritated for not achieving the goal?
exam_questions.options: ["A) We feel we are always falling behind others.", "B) We have to adapt to the ever-changing goal.", "C) There are various misconceptions about goal setting.", "D) There are always problems with the goal originally set."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者提到，我们因为未能实现目标而感到沮丧的问题在于目标总是在变化，无论我们是否意识到，我们总是在适应。由此可知，B项为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'The problem with finding ourselves irritated for not achieving the goal is because the goal always changes and we're always adapting, whether we realize it or not.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the speaker say has an immediate positive impact on our thinking?
exam_questions.options: ["A) A noticeable change in the number of goals to achieve.", "B) Measuring always against the gap rather than the gain.", "C) Measuring where we've come from instead of measuring against the goal.", "D) A proper conception of what we fail to notice in trying to achieve our goals"]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。讲话者在讲话末尾部分提到，当我们衡量曾经的境况（即"收益"）而非要实现的目标时，才能真正看到成果。这是一个简单却意义深远的观念的转变，它有能力瞬间提升我们的思维层次。它如此简单，却能对我们的思维产生立竿见影的积极影响。故选项C为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 讲话中提到：'In measuring where we've come from, rather than where we're trying to get to, we see results...It's so, so simple, yet has an immediate, positive impact on our thinking.'

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前是指活动词can，空格后是being frozen at，由此可知，空格处应填入一个动词原形，与动名词短语being frozen at构成动宾搭配。文章首句提及，地球上没有哪种生物比微小的缓步类动物更坚韧。本句承接上文，举例说明其坚韧性，由此可知，此处是说缓步类动物可以在零下272摄氏度的严寒中"存活"，survive符合语境，故选K。
exam_questions.explanation: 根据上下文，缓步类动物能在极端条件下存活，survive being frozen表示在冰冻状态下存活。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前是being，空格后是介词with，由此可知，空格处应填入一个形容词或过去分词。与"在零下272摄氏度的严寒中存活"构成并列关系的应该是"甚至能承受比人类致死剂量高出500倍的X射线辐射"，blast意为"向……猛吹或喷射"，在此处可引申为X射线的辐射，符合语境，故选B。
exam_questions.explanation: blasted with X-rays表示遭受X射线辐射。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格前是定冠词the，空格后是介词短语of space travel，由此可知，空格处应填入一个名词。联系本段前面讲述的缓步类动物极度坚韧的特点可知，此处是说，研究人员正从这种微观动物身上探寻奥秘，以学习如何让人类和农作物做好准备，应对太空旅行的"严酷"挑战，rigors符合语境，故选I。
exam_questions.explanation: rigors表示严酷、艰苦，the rigors of space travel指太空旅行的严酷环境。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格前是形容词性物主代词its，空格后是介词短语to its environment，由此可知，空格处应填入一个名词，且能与介词to搭配使用。本句主语indestructibility的意思是"不可摧毁的特性"，而谓语stems from意为"源于"，由此可知，本句揭示缓步类动物不可摧毁的特性的来源。这种动物能在各种极其恶劣的环境下生存，说明它们对环境的适应能力惊人，adaptations符合语境，故选A。
exam_questions.explanation: adaptations to its environment表示对环境的适应能力。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 副词辨析题。空格前是动词短语lives in，空格后是其宾语comfortable places，由此可知，空格应填入一个副词，对形容词comfortable进行修饰和限制。由which may seem surprising（这似乎令人惊讶）可知，此处用since引导原因状语从句解释它似乎令人惊讶的原因，由于一段的开头句"但事实证明，缓步类动物潮湿的苔藓家园每年会多次干涸"可知，缓步类动物生活的环境只是看似舒适，故空格处应填入seemingly，表示"看似（但可能并非如此）"，故选J。
exam_questions.explanation: seemingly comfortable places表示看似舒适的地方。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 形容词辨析题。空格前为is pretty，空格后是介词短语for most living things，由此可知，空格处应填入一个形容词，构成"be+adj.+for"的结构，pretty为副词，意为"十分，很"，修饰该形容词。上文提到，干燥对大多数生物来说是灾难性的，它对细胞造成损害的方式与冷冻、真空和辐射造成损害的方式部分相同，catastrophic符合语境，故选C。
exam_questions.explanation: catastrophic表示灾难性的，干燥对大多数生物来说是灾难性的。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前为Tardigrades, however, have，空格后为名词短语special strategies，由此可知空格处应填入一个过去分词，构成have done现在完成时的结构。上文提到，干燥对大多数生物来说是灾难性的，它对细胞造成损害的方式与冷冻、真空和辐射造成损害的方式部分相同。本句话锋一转，讲述特殊情况，即缓步类动物例外，它们进化出了应对这类损害的特殊策略，故evolved符合语境，本题应选D。
exam_questions.explanation: evolved special strategies表示进化出了特殊策略。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格前为long fibers that fill the cell's，空格后为句点，由此可知that引导定语从句，修饰先行词fibers，该定语从句的谓语动词叫做少宾语中心词，空格处应填入一个名词。由下一句的内容"这些纤维支撑着细胞的细胞膜和蛋白质，防止它们破裂……"可知，在水分消失的情况下，缓步类动物的蛋白质在生成的长纤维对细胞的细胞膜和蛋白质起支撑作用，因此它位于细胞内的内，interior符合语境，故选F。
exam_questions.explanation: interior表示内部，fill the cell's interior指填满细胞内部。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 动词辨析题。空格前是连词or，空格后是句点，由此可知，空格处应填入一个与breaking并列的动名词。结合上一题的分析，此处说的是长纤维的作用，即它支撑细胞的细胞膜和蛋白质，防止细胞膜和蛋白质破裂或"展开"，unfolding符合语境，故选O。
exam_questions.explanation: unfolding表示展开、打开，防止蛋白质展开失去功能。

exam_questions.options: ["A) adapting", "B) blasted", "C) catastrophic", "D) evolved", "E) feat", "F) interior", "G) probing", "H) recurrence", "I) rigors", "J) seemingly", "K) survive", "L) tempt", "M) thrill", "N) unanimously", "O) unfolding"]
exam_questions.analysis: 名词辨析题。空格前是they may accomplish this，空格后是逗号，由此可知，空格处应填入一个名词，充当accomplish的宾语。分析句意，空格处的名词与前面的if从句if humans ever succeed in reaching the stars表达的意思一致，"人类能成功抵达其他恒星"显然是人类的社会或功绩，故feat符合语境，本题应选E。
exam_questions.explanation: feat表示壮举、功绩，accomplish this feat指完成这一壮举。

exam_questions.question_text: The FAO concluded that farm animals were producing more greenhouse gases than all modes of transportation combined.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干关键词farm animals were producing more greenhouse gases than transportation定位到E段第四句。The agency即指代前文提到的联合国粮食及农业组织，句意为"该机构得出了一个令人震惊的结论，即畜牧业对气候的危害超过了所有交通运输方式的总和"。题干是对文章此句的同义表述，故答案为E。
exam_questions.explanation: E段第四句：'The agency drew a startling conclusion that livestock was doing more to harm the climate than all modes of transportation combined.'

exam_questions.question_text: Consumption of meat per person in developing countries is much less than that in countries like the U.S.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干中的Consumption of meat per person in developing countries定位到K段第三句。本句提到了发展中国家和发达国家人均肉类消费量的对比，明确指出，这些地区的人均肉类消费量仍低于发达国家。题干是对K段第三句的同义表述，故答案为K。
exam_questions.explanation: K段第三句：'But meat consumption per person in these regions still lags that of developed countries.'

exam_questions.question_text: The FAO was worthy of praise in that it admitted its mistake once it was pointed out.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。由题干关键词The FAO和admitted its mistake定位到H段第二句。第二句提到了FAO承认其所犯错误，指出"值得肯定的是，联合国粮食及农业组织立即承认了这一错误"。题干是对此句的同义表述，故答案为H。
exam_questions.explanation: H段第二句：'To its credit, the FAO immediately owned up to its error.'

exam_questions.question_text: Environmentalists try hard to make people consume less meat to combat climate change.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干关键词Environmentalists和make people consume less meat定位到A段第二句。该句指出，倡导保护自然环境免受破坏或污染的人士敦促公众少吃肉。题干是对此句的同义表述，故答案为A。
exam_questions.explanation: A段第二句：'Advocates for the protection of the natural environment from destruction or pollution urge the public to eat less meat.'

exam_questions.question_text: Recent research has shown that even if Americans quit eating meat altogether, the resulting reduction of greenhouse gases in the U.S. would be slight.
exam_questions.analysis: 细节归纳题。由题干关键词Americans quit eating meat altogether和reduction of greenhouse gases in the U.S.定位到I段第二句。I段集中分析了减少食用肉类与温室气体排放量降幅之间的关系。第二句指出，近期一项研究表明，即便美国人从饮食中剔除所有动物蛋白质，美国的温室气体排放量也仅能减少2.6%。题干是对此句的总结概括，故答案为I。
exam_questions.explanation: I段第二句：'But according to one recent study, even if Americans eliminated all animal protein from their diets, they would reduce U.S. greenhouse gas emissions by only 2.6 percent.'

exam_questions.question_text: More than half of the world's farmland is suitable only for animals like cows to graze on.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干关键词farmland is suitable only for animals和to graze on定位到M段最后一句。该句提到，根据联合国粮食及农业组织的数据，全球高达70%的农业用地是牧场，这些土地只能用作反刍牲畜的放牧场地。题干是对原文此句的同义表述，故答案为M。
exam_questions.explanation: M段最后一句：'According to the FAO, as much as 70 percent of all agricultural land globally is range land that can only be utilized as grazing land for ruminant livestock.'

exam_questions.question_text: The allegation that farm animals produce the world's largest portion of greenhouse gases is responsible for meat's bad reputation.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干关键词meat's bad reputation定位到D段第一句。该句指出，肉类的负面声誉在很大程度上源于一种说法，即畜牧业是全球最大的温室气体排放源。题干是对此句的同义表述，故答案为D。
exam_questions.explanation: D段第一句：'A healthy portion of meat's negative reputation centers on the assertion that livestock is the largest source of greenhouse gases worldwide.'

exam_questions.question_text: Raising farm animals makes it easier to meet people's nutritional needs.
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。由题干关键词Raising farm animals和meet people's nutritional needs定位到L段的第一句。该句提到，若将畜牧业从美国农业中移除，会使满足人们的营养需求变得更加困难。反过来说，也就是发展畜牧业更有助于满足人们的营养需求。题干是对文章此处的同义表述，故答案为L。
exam_questions.explanation: L段第一句：'Removing animals from U.S. agriculture would lower national greenhouse gas emissions to a small degree, but it would also make it harder to meet people's nutritional requirements.'

exam_questions.question_text: The author doesn't believe giving up meat and meat products will be a cure-all for the environmental problem.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干中的关键词a cure-all for the environmental problem定位到C段第三句。该句提到，彻底放弃肉类及肉制品并非许多人想让我们相信的那样，是环境的"万能解药"。题干是对原文此句的同义表述，故答案为C。
exam_questions.explanation: C段第三句：'However, abandoning meat and meat products is not the environmental panacea many would have us believe.'

exam_questions.question_text: Changes in America's farming technology and management in the past decades have increased efficiency and reduced greenhouse gas emissions in meat production.
exam_questions.analysis: 同义转述题。由题干关键词Changes in America's farming technology and management定位到J段第一句。该句提出，过去70年间美国农业领域技术、基因和管理方面的变革已使畜牧业的生产效率提升，温室气体排放强度降低。题干是对文章此句的同义表述，故答案为J。
exam_questions.explanation: J段第一句：'Moreover, technological, genetic and management changes that have taken place in U.S. agriculture over the past 70 years have made livestock production more efficient and less greenhouse gas-intensive.'

exam_questions.question_text: What gives rise to our worry about careers apart from money?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Fear of being judged in a snobbish manner.", "B) The prospect of facing fault-finding managers.", "C) The ruthless way employees are often treated.", "D) Fright at the difficulty in hunting for a job."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词worry about和apart from money可将答案线索定位至前两段。第一段提到，我们之所以担心自己的职业，部分原因与金钱有关，但这种担忧也有心理层面的原因；第二段具体阐述了心理原因，即我们怀疑这个世界上有很多势利小人，他们随时准备无情且迅速地对我们做出评判。A项是对原文内容的概括，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 第二段：'We worry because we suspect — not wrongly — that the world is full of a frightening sort of person ready to judge us ruthlessly and swiftly: a person we can call a snob.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn from the passage about today's snobs?
exam_questions.options: ["A) They try hard to dig into a person's past.", "B) They draw a rigid conclusion about people.", "C) They judge a person by their occupation.", "D) They tend to place people in a social context."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词today's snobs可将答案线索定位至第三段。第二段已经介绍过，势利小人是那些随时准备无情且迅速地对他人做出评判的人，第三段最后一句话指出，如今，势利小人只关心一件事：你的职业是什么。由此可知，如今的势利小人通过职业来评判一个人，故C项正确。
exam_questions.explanation: 第三段最后一句：'Nowadays, the snob cares about one thing only: what you do for a living.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author say about people's interest in material goods?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It is the cause for condemnation of their greed.", "B) It has a lot to do with the comforts they provide.", "C) It arouses pity rather than respect from the wealthy.", "D) It arises from their craving for social recognition."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词people's interest和material goods可将答案线索定位至第六段。由第六段第三句可知，人们对物质财富的兴趣与他们对尊重和敬重的渴望有关，也就是说人们希望通过获取物质财富来获得社会的认可，D项与原文表述相符，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 第六段第三句：'It has to do with a hunger for the respect and esteem that is only available in our societies through the acquisition of material goods.'

exam_questions.question_text: What kind of people do snobs deem worth respect and esteem?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Those with fame and fortune.", "B) Those with regimented minds.", "C) Those with intelligence and imagination.", "D) Those with qualities lying hidden in disguise."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词worth respect and esteem可将答案线索定位至第七段。第七段第三句提到，对于势利小人来说，只有已然声名显赫的成功人士才值得尊重。A项符合原文描述，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 第七段第三句：'For snobs, it is the already acclaimed and already successful who are the only ones worthy of respect.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the author imply we should do to avoid being snobbish?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Be aware there has never been such a thing as a better or worse person.", "B) Be kind to and curious about those who we happen to meet in our lives.", "C) Realize that better or worse keeps changing in unexpected ways.", "D) Judge people on the basis of their distinctive character traits."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。根据题干信息词imply和avoid being snobbish可将答案线索定位至最后一段。作者在最后一段提出了如何避免变得势利的方法，即对每一个出现在我们生活中的人，保持友好、善良、好奇与充满想象力。B项表述与原文相符，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 最后一段：'...our ultimate duty remains to be kind, good curious and imaginative about pretty much everyone who ever crosses our path.'

exam_questions.question_text: What do we learn about the gender pay gap in the US during the 1980s?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It was being slowly closed.", "B) It was shrinking rapidly.", "C) It started to yawn.", "D) It remained substantial."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词the gender pay gap和during the 1980s可将答案线索定位至第一段。第一段明确提到，在20世纪80年代的美国，女性薪资开始快速赶上上来。在那十年间，性别薪资差距每年缩小约一个百分点，并指出如果这一趋势持续下去，到2017年，性别薪资差距就会消失。这表明20世纪80年代差距缩小的速度很快。选项B"它正快速缩小"准确概括了这一现象，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 第一段：'But in the US in the 1980s, they began to catch up — fast. During that decade, the gender pay gap closed by about one percentage point a year.'

exam_questions.question_text: What happened with the introduction of state and federal family leave policies?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The process towards salary equity at work began to reverse.", "B) The rate of gender wage convergence started to fall noticeably.", "C) The trend of women returning to work after childbirth started.", "D) The narrowing of the gender pay gap attracted more attention."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词family leave policies可将答案线索定位至第三至五段。第二段首次谈及家庭休假政策，第四段谈论这项政策对性别薪资差距的负面影响，第五段用数据佐证负面影响：美国实施家庭休假政策后，性别薪资差距缩小速度降至每年仅0.03个百分点。这与选项B"性别薪资差距缩小速度显著下降"完全吻合，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 第五段：'After family leave was introduced in the US, in fact, the rate of gender wage convergence fell to just 0.03 percentage points per year, and has remained there ever since.'

exam_questions.question_text: What partly accounts for the slip in women's salaries?
exam_questions.options: ["A) The insufficient motivation women generally have for career advancement.", "B) The opportunities numerous women give up for pay raise and promotion.", "C) The huge amounts of time and energy women spend taking care of the family.", "D) The lack of policy support from government and business corporations."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词accounts for the slip in women's salaries，可将答案线索定位至倒数第三、四段。倒数第四段提及女性在生育后薪资开始落后于男性的现象，并在下一段具体说明了原因。部分原因在于，女性承担了更多家庭中所做的无偿劳动，这将占了她们用于工作和职业发展的时间和精力。选项C与此相符，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 倒数第三段：'Part of this is because women take on more of the unpaid labor at home, which can eat into time available for work and energy for career advancement.'

exam_questions.question_text: What does the new study say about wage parity?
exam_questions.options: ["A) It would have stalled if those controllable problems had not been addressed.", "B) It would have halted if company and government had not worked together.", "C) It would have been achieved with the complete erasure of gender biases.", "D) It would have been attained with the continuation of the 1980s trend."]
exam_questions.analysis: 细节辨认题。根据题干信息词new study和wage parity，可将答案线索定位至倒数第二段。倒数第二段明确指出，新研究指出若延续20世纪80年代的趋势，如今不可实现薪资平等。选项D准确概括了研究的核心结论，即如果维持20世纪80年代的薪资缩小速度，理论上已经可以实现平等，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 倒数第二段：'...other than to say that if the 1980s trend continued, we would have been at parity by now.'

exam_questions.question_text: What prevents women from achieving parity with men in the final analysis?
exam_questions.options: ["A) Ignoring biases against women in the workplace.", "B) Giving birth to children and taking care of them.", "C) Failing to mandate breaks for childbirth and care.", "D) Lacking resources to address biological problems."]
exam_questions.analysis: 推理判断题。根据题干信息词prevents women from achieving parity和final analysis，可将答案线索定位至最后一段。文章最后得出结论，由于哺乳能力等生理因素，女性必然要求担生育责任并在产后初期照顾婴儿，这迫使他们不得不休假，无论这种休假是否是被强制要求的。选项B指出了女性面临的最根本障碍——由生育和抚养子女带来的生理性职业中断，故为正确答案。
exam_questions.explanation: 最后一段：'...women — who are the ones to bear children and take care of them in the early weeks because of biological factors like the ability to breastfeed, forcing them to take breaks, whether or not those breaks were mandated.'

exam_questions.question_text: Translate the Chinese passage into English.
exam_questions.analysis: 翻译题目，需要学生将中文段落准确翻译成英文，注意语法、词汇和句式结构的正确性
exam_questions.explanation: 考查学生的汉译英能力，包括词汇选择、语法结构、句式转换和语言表达的准确性
